item.title: [GROOVY-10869] NullPointerException in instruction selection phase when having parameterized method
item.description:
The following (complicated) test case makes the compiler produce an NullPointerException:

class Foo<T> {
  Foo(T x) {}

  <T extends Short> T m(T x) {
    x
  }
}

class Test {
  static final void test() {
    Foo<Integer> tmp = new Foo<Integer>(-76);
    boolean cond = 5.0 > tmp.m(new Foo<Integer>(95).m(null));
  }
}

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: There are a few compare methods for BigDecimal on LHS. The distance check for short to character is where the NPE is. getPrimitiveDistance could use NUMBER_TYPES.getOrDefault(primType, 9) or some kind of guard for boolean, char and void.
